Class Connect4Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Connect4Model

  • public class Connect4Model
extends java.util.Observable
    Holds the board of Connect4.
    Author:
    Michael Dam, Aaron Valenzuela Internally uses a 2D array/grid of integers called board. Board is int row tall and int col wide. Use board[0][0] to access the top left, board[row-1][0] to access bottom left... dropToken(token, col) drops a token from top to bottom into the 2D array. VALID TOKENS: 1 - YELLOW 2 - RED A 0 in the grid means that slot is empty. Initializing the board fills the grid with 0. When a token is dropped or the board is initialized, all Observers will be notified and passed the row/col of the position that changed, and the token it changed to. It will be passed 0 for color when the board is initialized.

      • getCol

        public int getCol()

      • dropToken

        public boolean dropToken(int token,
                         int col)
        Drops a token in a column.
        Parameters:
        col - an int telling which column to drop token in.
        token - an int telling what type of token to use (1 = YELLOW, 2 = RED)
        Returns:
        false if dropToken failed (including bound errors, or simply a full column), true if dropToken succeeded

      • checkVictory

        public int checkVictory()
        Checks the current state of the board for any victories.
        Returns:
        0 for none, 1 for yellow, 2 for red victory

      • printDebug

        public void printDebug()
        Prints to console what the model looks like in the form of a grid of integers.

      • checkRight

        private int checkRight(int row,
                       int col)
        Checks the token of given position with the 3 positions to the right.
        Parameters:
        row - int row of the position to be checked
        col - int col of the position to be checked
        Returns:
        0 if token differs, else return that token's value
